page.title: 11MUIR BURNING
page.content: One weekend at Easter I went down to my Gran's at Clashnessie. The next day I went heather (muir) burning with Norman at the Falls-side of his croft. You sometimes need to burn heather when the old heather is too tough for the sheep to chew. The old growth will be replaced by new shoots and grass. When you set a fire you must watch it until it burns out. This spring-time many fires in the Assynt area ran out of control. This was probably due to a long spell without heavy rain. Fire brigades from Lochinver and Ullapool battled through the night to contain the blazes. Luckily no livestock were killed. Heather burning can only be carried out until the 1st April before the birds start building their nests.
